body_html:
@yaroslavvb I've updated the draft to address your comment to support sparse job config.
I added a new parameter 'sparse_jobs_config' to allow users to specify related job's task_index so that only those host addresses get propagated back from the master server.

Does this mean you would create two distributed servers, one for each job?

Each task launch their own server.There should only be one master for each cluster. I should clarify that the worker referenced in 'num_workers' in the parameter is not job_name='worker', but type of server.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Thanks

body:
@yaroslavvb I've updated the draft to address your comment to support sparse job config.
I added a new parameter 'sparse_jobs_config' to allow users to specify related job's task_index so that only those host addresses get propagated back from the master server.

> Does this mean you would create two distributed servers, one for each job?

Each **task** launch their own server.There should only be one master for each cluster. I should clarify that the worker referenced in 'num_workers' in the parameter is not job_name='worker', but type of server.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Thanks
